metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23956 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An ambiguous file picker design could have confused users who intended to select and upload a single file into uploading a whole directory. This was addressed by adding a new prompt. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 85.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23956` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
